subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Digital Voice Recorder Advice

Hello Bill,

Yes, I did steal that phrase from Ursula because I thought it =
described what I was doing as compared to what I would like to be doing!

I=
 like what you said about focus on the equipment helping to establish the p=
sychic connection.  It makes so much sense.  This discussion has definitely=
 shown me that mental tools and preparation are as important as physical on=
es.  

Thank you for your input.

Robin


  ----- Original Message ----- 
 =
 From: psi_research<mailto:vilhellm@...> 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogrou=
ps.com<mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com> 
  Sent: Friday, December 28, 2007 9=
:37 PM
  Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Digital Voice Recorder Advice


  oops. I s=
ee it was Ursula who posted the "r vs. r" statement. And
  Ursula your post=
 is so much more eloquent and you've articulated the
  point much better th=
an I could. I'll bow out of your way -Bill 

  --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.c=
om<mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com>, "psi_research" <vilhellm@...> wrote:
  =
>
  > Hi Robin,
  > Your phrase of "ritualized vs. random" is interesting. =
There are many
  > who believe that communication is between the conscious =
of the
  > researcher and the entity and the equipment is secondary. It's e=
asy to
  > get swept up in the technology and forget there is possibly a ps=
ychic
  > connection going on. With that said, focusing on equipment actual=
ly
  > can help the researcher become receptive to establishing a
  > commu=
nication link. While paying attention to the equipment, we forget
  > about=
 the daily distractions and minor irritations that may prevent us
  > from =
establishing contact. 
  > 
  > The setting up the gear we use could be con=
sidered the first part of
  > the "ritual". I like to clear my mind, set up=
 equipment, mess with it
  > some more, then I am mentally prepare to begin=
 what I hope will be a
  > successful session.
  > 
  > I guess "random" re=
cording to me would be what happens in the field
  > during a paranormal in=
vestigation. I don't bring Box technology into a
  > location with the inte=
ntion of possibly contacting lingering spirits
  > at that location but I d=
o bring audio recorders in hopes of recording
  > evp's.
  > 
  > I find th=
e Box works perhaps even better when I'm in a familiar place
  > like the r=
oom in my home that is designated for that purpose. I do
  > desire to have=
 the finest Box technology that is possible but more
  > important is the a=
ssociation that seems to occur between the
  > researcher and the Box that =
is favored. Despite some of the benefits
  > of the new gear, the one that =
I seem to have a connection with is one
  > that requires a little more fin=
esse to operate. -Bill
  > 
  > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-I=
TC%40yahoogroups.com>, "Robin Henson" <MudPuddleFarm@> wrote:
  > >
  > > W=
ow, thanks for your help guys!
  > > 
  > > Ursula, your post was lovely. I=
've been promising myself to learn 
  > > more about Mark Macy's work and w=
ill check out his website ASAP. 
  > > Ritualized versus random recording m=
akes sense to me now, as I want 
  > > to accomplish true communication rat=
her than continue being verbally 
  > > abused. Have you given up "ghost hu=
nting" altogether? 
  > > 
  > > I've been looking at the Olympus VN-4100 P=
C, Zack! I don't know if I 
  > > need that much recording time, but I sure=
 have liked the one I have 
  > > and wouldn't mind upgrading a bit. 
  > >=
 
  > > Hi Frank! I basically follow your suggestion when recording, and on=
ce 
  > > I learned to be quiet I actually started getting responses. I thi=
nk 
  > > the entities at my house got tired of playing with me though, and=
 now 
  > > they aren't saying anything. I kind of miss them, but I do feel=
 it's 
  > > time to move on.
  > > 
  > > Robin 
  > > 
  > > 
  > > 
  > =
> 
  > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>, =
Zack Widup <w9sz@> wrote:
  > > >
  > > > 
  > > > Hi Robin,
  > > > 
  > >=
 > Radio Shack now carries the Olympus VN-4100PC at about the same 
  > > p=
rice I 
  > > > paid for my VN-960PC a couple years ago. I've been very hap=
py with 
  > > the 
  > > > 960. The 4100 has about 4 times the recording t=
ime, I think. That 
  > > would 
  > > > make it about 24 hours.
  > > > 
 =
 > > > Zack
  > > > 
  > > > On Sat, 29 Dec 2007, Robin Henson wrote:
  > >=
 > 
  > > > > Hi all,
  > > > >
  > > > > I'm new to the group but probably=
 know some of you from another
  > > > > list. I haven't been too active in=
 the realm of EVP recording
  > > > > recently, but have had what I conside=
r excellent results in the 
  > > past
  > > > > using my little refurbishe=
d Ebay-bargain Olympus VN-120 PC.
  > > > >
  > > > > I'm anxious to start =
recording again and am feeling pretty
  > > > > overwhelmed by the technolo=
gy you all seem to be using. I know a
  > > > > little about using good hea=
dphones and denoiser programs, but 
  > > beyond
  > > > > that I'm electro=
nically challenged. Still, I wonder if there are
  > > > > simple technique=
s I can experiment with to increase my success. I
  > > > > think I'm a lit=
tle bored.
  > > > >
  > > > > I've felt pretty strongly that I've been com=
municating with a very
  > > > > small number of entities, and I'm wonderin=
g if that's due to the
  > > > > limitations of my equipment. My most impre=
ssive EVPs have always 
  > > been
  > > > > captured around my own home, p=
articularly outside on the hill and
  > > > > near the barn. I've gotten tw=
o inside my house (after inviting
  > > > > spirits in), and probably 75% i=
n total have been negative 
  > > messages.
  > > > >
  > > > > Anyway, I'm=
 thinking about getting another DVR and would love to 
  > > hear
  > > > >=
 your thoughts and recommendations about which ones are best. I 
  > > woul=
d
  > > > > like to communicate with more advanced entities eventually, but=

  > > > > unfortunately don't have the brain for building anything myself.=

  > > > >
  > > > > Thanks!
  > > > >
  > > > > Robin
  > > > >
  > > > >

  > > > >
  > > > >
